titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to President's Office (Richard M. Turner) Records 1972-1990
Lane Community College President's Office (Turner, Richard M.) Records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jason Shimabukuro, 2002, and Elizabeth Uhlig, 2005-2006
titlestmt.sponsor: Funding for preparing this finding aid was provided through a grant awarded by the National Historical Publications and Records Commission. Funding for encoding the finding aid was provided by the National Endowment for the Humanities.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Elizabeth Uhlig. 2006
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid written in English. English.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS Describing Archives: A Content Standard

did.abstract: Correspondence, subject files, and administrative records documenting the tenure of Richard M. Turner, president of Lane Community College, 1985-1988.

bioghist.p: Richard Martin Turner is a native of Charleston, South Carolina. He received a bachelor’s degree from Fisk University in Nashville, Tennessee, in 1956; a master’s degree in music education from Indiana University in 1961; and a doctorate in music education from Indiana University in 1972.

He began his academic career at Stillman College in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, where he was an associate professor of music and chair of the Department of Music (1956-1968). From 1968-1971 he was chairman of the Department of Music at Fisk University. Fisk University awarded him an honorary doctor of humane letters in 1980.

He began his career in community college administration at the Community College of Baltimore in Maryland; he served as dean of student activities, dean of faculty, and provost, 1971-1979. He served as president of South Central Community College in New Haven, Connecticut, 1979-1985.
Turner was president of Lane Community College, 1985-1988.

He was president of the Nashville Technical Institute in Nashville, Tennessee, 1988-91. From 1992-1996, he served as campus dean, provost, interim president, and executive vice-president at Wayne County Community College District in Detroit, Michigan. He was president of Turner Associates Mentors, Inc. from1966-2004. Since 2004, he has been interim president of Baltimore City Community College.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains the correspondence, subject files, and administrative records documenting the tenure of college president Richard M. Turner, 1985-1988. The collection documents the activities of the president including his dealings with departments, programs, and committees as well as his participation and involvement with organizations outside of the college. The collection also includes Turner's speeches and writings.

arrangement.p: The collection contains the correspondence and administrative records documenting the tenure of college president Richard M. Turner, 1985-1988. The collection is divided into five series:
2. Internal Organizations - College Departments, Committees, and Subject Files, 1972 – 1990

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research with the exception of legal records.

prefercite.p: President's Office (Richard M. Turner) Records, 1972-1990 (A-039), Lane Community College Archives, Eugene, Oregon

acqinfo.p: Records were transferred from the President's Office to the college archives in seven accessions between 1988 and 2004

processinfo.p: The records from seven accessions were consolidated into one collection when they were were processed by Jason Shimabukuro in 2002 and Elizabeth Uhlig in 2005-2006.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

controlaccess.corpname: League for Innovation in the Community College

dsc.p: The following section contains a detailed listing of the materials in the collection.
Folder label descriptions with dates are followed by the box/folder number.

scopecontent.p: This series contains chronological correspondence, as well as correspondence to and from college administrators: Julie Aspinwall-Lamberts, director of Institutional Research, Planning and Evaluation; Jacque Belcher, vice president for instruction; Jack Carter, vice president for student services and interim president following Turner; Richard Hillier, vice president for administrative services; and Larry Warford, assistant to the president.

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to the public.

arrangement.p: Correspondence is arranged chronologically and also alphabetically by name of correspondent.

did.unittitle: Correspondence, Julie Aspinwall-Lamberts, Director of Institutional Research, Planning and Evaluation
Correspondence, Jacque Belcher, Vice-President for Instruction
Correspondence, John (Jack) Carter, Vice President for Student Services, Interim President
Correspondence, Richard Hillier, Vice President for Administrative Services
Correspondence, Larry Warford, Assistant to the President
Internal Organizations - College Departments, Committees, and Subject Files

scopecontent.p: This series contains subject files arranged alphabetically. The subject files concern the president’s interaction with college administrative and instructional departments and college committees. They also include topical files that document the wide variety of issues facing the college, including faculty, classified, and management labor relations, the LCC Foundation, and facilities.

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to the public.

did.unittitle: Board of Education, Executive and Work Sessions
Board of Education, Members, Mae Westfall Cook, Charlene Curry, Martin Lewis, William
Huang, Frank, University of Oregon doctoral student
Leaders of the 80s, Marie Matsen, Library Project
Library Computer Project, Marie Matsen, League Leaders Project
Management Professional Development and Leave Committee
Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument, Dennis Lueck
U. S. Senators (Mark Hatfield, Bob Packwood)

scopecontent.p: This contains files relating to organizations outside of the college. These are regional organizations such as local chambers of commerce, other community colleges in Oregon, Oregon state educational agencies, Oregon community college organizations, and national organizations, such as the League for Innovation in the Community College.

scopecontent.p: This series contains Turner’s speeches and writings.

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to the public.

scopecontent.p: This contains legal records which are retained for historical interest. The series contains records concerning ASHLane (a case involving student housing) and financial aid and Adult Basic and Secondary Education personnel issues.

accessrestrict.p: Because these records may contain employee personnel records, they are confidential and access is restricted.
